pageContext.claim: “Now it's election day, we had 32,000 people show up [at a Michigan rally]. It was like this. … And the opponent [Hillary Clinton] went there with Barack Obama and Michelle Obama, and she went there much earlier primetime 1 o'clock, 2 o'clock in the morning is not exactly primetime. So we had 32,000 and they had a tiny little crowd.”
pageContext.analysis: As usual, Trump inflates the number of people attending one of his rallies. The Detroit Free Press reported that night that DeVos Place in downtown Grand Rapids, Mich., where Trump held a midnight rally, has a capacity of 4,200, far less than the 32,000 that Trump claimed. Clinton held her rally the same day at nearby Grand Valley State University; it was described as a "capacity crowd" at a venue that holds 4,100 people. Neither Barack nor Michelle Obama attended this Clinton rally, so this claim from Trump is false in every way.
